title: India Needs Better Cybersecurity for Space Systems
summary: Dr. Sreedhara Panicker Somanath, chairman of the Indian Space Research Organization, emphasized the importance of cybersecurity for the entire system during the recent inauguration of a cybersecurity training center.

title: Critical GeoServer Flaw Enabling Global Hack Campaigns
summary: The flaw in GeoServer, tracked as CVE-2024-36401 and with a CVSS score of 9.8, was swiftly capitalized on by hackers who launched campaigns using botnet families and cryptominers to spread malicious tools like Goreverse, a reverse proxy server.

title: India's Critical Infrastructure Suffers Spike in Cyberattacks
summary: India is experiencing a rise in cyberattacks on its critical infrastructure, particularly in the financial and government sectors, prompting the Reserve Bank of India to issue warnings about the need for enhanced cybersecurity measures.

title: MegaMedusa, RipperSec’s Public Web DDoS Attack Tool
summary: RipperSec, a pro-Palestinian hacktivist group based in Malaysia, has released MegaMedusa, a publicly available Web DDoS attack tool that simplifies launching large-scale DDoS attacks.

title: Update: Ransomware Attack on Indian Payment System Traced Back to Jenkins Bug
summary: A recent ransomware attack on Indian payment systems has been traced back to a vulnerability in the widely used Jenkins automation system. The attack targeted a digital payment system used by many Indian banks.

title: Feds Seize Radar/Dispossessor Ransomware Gang Servers in US and Europe
summary: Federal authorities have seized servers belonging to the Radar/Dispossessor ransomware gang in the U.S. and Europe. The FBI dismantled dozens of servers linked to the group, which is believed to have ties to the LockBit ransomware enterprise.

title: Ransomware Attack On Service Provider Hits 300 Small Banks Across India
summary: The attack targeted C-Edge Technologies, a provider of banking systems for these banks. As a precaution, the National Payment Corporation of India (NPCI) has isolated these banks from the broader payment network to contain the attack.

title: Phishing Campaign Targeting Mobile Users in India Using India Post Lures
summary: FortiGuard Labs Threat Research team has identified a fraud campaign targeting India Post users on social media, specifically iPhone users through smishing attacks. The Smishing Triad, a Chinese threat actor, is believed to be behind this campaign.

title: Patchwork Group Found Using Brute Ratel C4 and an Enhanced Version of PGoShell Backdoor
summary: Patchwork hackers targeted Bhutan using the advanced Brute Ratel C4 tool, along with an updated backdoor called PGoShell. This marks the first time Patchwork has been observed using the red teaming software.

title: TransparentTribe’s Spear-Phishing Targeting Indian Government Departments
summary: The malicious file, disguised as “Recommendation for the award of President’s.docm,” contained a VBA script that executed the CrimsonRAT remote control program, capable of stealing sensitive information.

title: Russia-Linked Brute-Force Campaign Targets EU via Microsoft Infrastructure
summary: The attackers are primarily targeting High-Value Targets (HVTs) in key infrastructure cities like Edinburgh and Dublin. Over half of the attack IPs are from Moscow, with the rest traced back to Amsterdam and Brussels.

title: North Korean Hackers May Have Attacked Indian Crypto Exchange WazirX
summary: Indian crypto exchange WazirX disclosed a loss of virtual assets worth more than $230 million due to a cyber attack linked to North Korea. The attack targeted a multi-signature wallet with six signatories, leading to a breach in security measures.

title: New BugSleep Backdoor Deployed in Recent MuddyWater Campaigns
summary: The deployment of BugSleep is a significant development in MuddyWater's tactics, targeting various sectors with phishing emails leading to the distribution of Remote Management Tools and the BugSleep malware.

title: Smishing Triad Targets India with Fraud Surge
summary: Warnings have been issued in India regarding a rise in fraudulent smishing attacks, with scammers impersonating India Post to deceive people into giving personal information or clicking on malicious links.

title: Regional Transport Office Themed Phishing Campaign Targets Android Users In India
summary: Phishing messages impersonating the Regional Transport Office have been circulating since 2024, claiming traffic violations and prompting users to download a malicious APK named "VAHAN PARIVAHAN.apk".

title: Indian Government Issues Serious Warning on Phishing Scams Alleging Sexual Offenses
summary: The emails falsely accuse recipients of sexual offences, using names and seals of authorities to appear authentic. Citizens are advised not to respond to such emails and report them to authorities.

title: Pro-Bangladeshi Hacktivists Enter Global Stage with Matryoshka 424 Alliance
summary: Team ARXU gained recognition earlier this year for targeting Romania over its support for Israel. The hacker group has a history of cyberattacks against Israel and its allies.

title: CapraRAT Spyware Variant Disguised as Popular Apps to Target Android Users
summary: The recent campaign shows updates to the group's techniques and social engineering tactics, as well as efforts to maximize the spyware's compatibility with older and modern versions of the Android operating system.

title: Chinese Cyberspies Employ Ransomware in Attacks for Diversion
summary: The adoption of ransomware in cyberespionage attacks helps adversaries blur the lines between APT and cybercriminal activity, leading to potential misattribution or concealing the true nature of the operation.

title: Pakistani Hackers Use DISGOMOJI Malware to Target Indian Government
summary: The threat actor uses a malware called DISGOMOJI, written in Golang, to infect Linux systems. DISGOMOJI is a modified version of Discord-C2, utilizing emojis for its command and control communication through Discord.

title: Pakistani APT 'Celestial Force' Spies on Indian Government, Defense Organizations
summary: A Pakistani threat actor called Cosmic Leopard has been conducting cyber espionage against Indian government-associated entities for the past six years using the GravityRAT Trojan for Windows and Android devices and the HeavyLift malware loader.

title: Noodle RAT: Reviewing the New Backdoor Used by Chinese-Speaking Groups
summary: Noodle RAT is a backdoor used by Chinese-speaking groups for cybercrime and espionage. This malware, both its Windows and Linux versions, has existed since 2016 but was misidentified as variants of other malware.

title: TargetCompany’s Linux Variant Targets ESXi Environments
summary: The TargetCompany ransomware group is now employing a new Linux variant that uses a custom shell script as a means of payload delivery and execution, a technique not seen in previous variants.

title: Indian Stock Exchange to Now Encrypt All Trader Messages
summary: India's Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) has told market participants they need to adopt encryption – which, shockingly, isn't already implemented – for certain messages sent to its trading platforms when using its Enhanced Trading Interface (ETI).

title: Indian Man Stole $37 Million in Crypto Using Fake Coinbase Pro Site
summary: The fake site was created to trick legitimate Coinbase customers into entering their login credentials and two-factor authentication codes, thinking it was the actual site.

title: Pakistani-Aligned APT36 Targets Indian Defense Organizations
summary: A politically motivated hacking group aligned with Pakistani interests is matching the Indian military's shift away from the Windows operating system with a heavy focus on malware encoded for Linux.

title: Cybercriminals are Targeting Elections in India With Influence Campaigns
summary: Around 16 different independent hacktivist groups are targeting Indian elections, including Anon Black Flag Indonesia, Anonymous Bangladesh, and Morocco Black Cyber Army, among others.

title: SideCopy APT Campaign Found Targeting Indian Universities
summary: Active since May 2023, the SideCopy APT campaign targets university students through sophisticated infection chains involving malicious LNK files, HTAs, and loader DLLs disguised as legitimate documents.

title: FCC Reveals Royal Tiger, its First Tagged Robocall Threat Actor
summary: The FCC's new robocall bad actor classification system, called Consumer Communications Information Services Threat (C-CIST), aims to help authorities identify and track threat actors abusing telecommunications infrastructure.

title: Researchers Sinkhole PlugX Malware Server With 2.5 Million Unique IPs
summary: Researchers have sinkholed a command and control server for a variant of the PlugX malware and observed in six months more than 2.5 million connections from unique IP addresses.

title: Androxgh0st Malware Compromises Servers Worldwide for Botnet Attack
summary: Androxgh0st operators are exploiting multiple CVEs, including CVE-2021-3129 and CVE-2024-1709 to deploy a web shell on vulnerable servers, granting remote control capabilities. Evidence also suggests active web shells associated with CVE-2019-2725.

title: Chinese-Linked LightSpy iOS Spyware Targets South Asian iPhone Users
summary: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a "renewed" cyber espionage campaign targeting users in South Asia with the aim of delivering an Apple iOS spyware implant called LightSpy.

title: 'eXotic Visit' Spyware Campaign Targets Android Users in India and Pakistan
summary: The campaign is said to be highly targeted in nature, with the apps available on Google Play having a negligible number of installs ranging from zero to 45. The apps have since been taken down.

title: India Says it has Rescued 250 Citizens From Cambodian Cyber Slavery
summary: On Saturday, India’s Ministry of External Affairs responded to local media reports about Indians trapped in Cambodia, saying they are closely collaborating with Cambodian authorities to rescue them.

title: India's Android Users Hit by Malware-as-a-Service Campaign
summary: According to Broadcom, the campaign distributes malicious APK packages and seeks out banking information, SMS messages, and other sensitive information from a victim's device.

title: Report: Over 12 Million Auth Secrets and Keys Leaked on GitHub in 2023
summary: The "leakiest" countries in 2023 were India, the United States, Brazil, China, and others. The IT sector was the most affected, accounting for 65.9% of leaked secrets, followed by education at 20.1%, and other sectors making up the remaining 14%.

title: Critical Fortinet Flaw May Impact 150,000 Exposed Devices
summary: Approximately 150,000 Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy secure web gateway systems are vulnerable to CVE-2024-21762, a critical security issue that allows code execution without authentication.

title: GhostLocker 2.0 Haunts Businesses Across Middle East, Africa, and Asia
summary: Cybercriminal groups GhostSec and Stormous have collaborated to unleash GhostLocker 2.0 ransomware in targeted attacks across the Middle East, Africa, and Asia, affecting organizations in various sectors.

title: How the Application ‘XHelper’ Is Powering the Indian Money-Laundering Gig Economy
summary: Cybercriminals in India are using the XHelper app to recruit money mules in order to launder illicitly obtained funds through fake payment gateways and cryptocurrency conversions.

title: Multistage RA World Ransomware Uses Anti-AV Tactics, Exploits GPO
summary: The RA World ransomware employs multi-stage components to target healthcare organizations in the Latin American region, signifying a strategic and targeted approach to compromising systems within the target network.

summary: Warnings have been issued in India regarding a rise in fraudulent smishing attacks, with scammers impersonating India Post to deceive people into giving personal information or clicking on malicious links.

title: Regional Transport Office Themed Phishing Campaign Targets Android Users In India
summary: Phishing messages impersonating the Regional Transport Office have been circulating since 2024, claiming traffic violations and prompting users to download a malicious APK named "VAHAN PARIVAHAN.apk".

title: Indian Government Issues Serious Warning on Phishing Scams Alleging Sexual Offenses
summary: The emails falsely accuse recipients of sexual offences, using names and seals of authorities to appear authentic. Citizens are advised not to respond to such emails and report them to authorities.

title: Pro-Bangladeshi Hacktivists Enter Global Stage with Matryoshka 424 Alliance
summary: Team ARXU gained recognition earlier this year for targeting Romania over its support for Israel. The hacker group has a history of cyberattacks against Israel and its allies.

title: CapraRAT Spyware Variant Disguised as Popular Apps to Target Android Users
summary: The recent campaign shows updates to the group's techniques and social engineering tactics, as well as efforts to maximize the spyware's compatibility with older and modern versions of the Android operating system.

title: Chinese Cyberspies Employ Ransomware in Attacks for Diversion
summary: The adoption of ransomware in cyberespionage attacks helps adversaries blur the lines between APT and cybercriminal activity, leading to potential misattribution or concealing the true nature of the operation.

title: Pakistani Hackers Use DISGOMOJI Malware to Target Indian Government
summary: The threat actor uses a malware called DISGOMOJI, written in Golang, to infect Linux systems. DISGOMOJI is a modified version of Discord-C2, utilizing emojis for its command and control communication through Discord.

title: Pakistani APT 'Celestial Force' Spies on Indian Government, Defense Organizations
summary: A Pakistani threat actor called Cosmic Leopard has been conducting cyber espionage against Indian government-associated entities for the past six years using the GravityRAT Trojan for Windows and Android devices and the HeavyLift malware loader.

title: Noodle RAT: Reviewing the New Backdoor Used by Chinese-Speaking Groups
summary: Noodle RAT is a backdoor used by Chinese-speaking groups for cybercrime and espionage. This malware, both its Windows and Linux versions, has existed since 2016 but was misidentified as variants of other malware.

title: TargetCompany’s Linux Variant Targets ESXi Environments
summary: The TargetCompany ransomware group is now employing a new Linux variant that uses a custom shell script as a means of payload delivery and execution, a technique not seen in previous variants.

title: Indian Stock Exchange to Now Encrypt All Trader Messages
summary: India's Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) has told market participants they need to adopt encryption – which, shockingly, isn't already implemented – for certain messages sent to its trading platforms when using its Enhanced Trading Interface (ETI).

title: Indian Man Stole $37 Million in Crypto Using Fake Coinbase Pro Site
summary: The fake site was created to trick legitimate Coinbase customers into entering their login credentials and two-factor authentication codes, thinking it was the actual site.

title: Pakistani-Aligned APT36 Targets Indian Defense Organizations
summary: A politically motivated hacking group aligned with Pakistani interests is matching the Indian military's shift away from the Windows operating system with a heavy focus on malware encoded for Linux.

title: Cybercriminals are Targeting Elections in India With Influence Campaigns
summary: Around 16 different independent hacktivist groups are targeting Indian elections, including Anon Black Flag Indonesia, Anonymous Bangladesh, and Morocco Black Cyber Army, among others.

title: SideCopy APT Campaign Found Targeting Indian Universities
summary: Active since May 2023, the SideCopy APT campaign targets university students through sophisticated infection chains involving malicious LNK files, HTAs, and loader DLLs disguised as legitimate documents.

title: FCC Reveals Royal Tiger, its First Tagged Robocall Threat Actor
summary: The FCC's new robocall bad actor classification system, called Consumer Communications Information Services Threat (C-CIST), aims to help authorities identify and track threat actors abusing telecommunications infrastructure.

title: Researchers Sinkhole PlugX Malware Server With 2.5 Million Unique IPs
summary: Researchers have sinkholed a command and control server for a variant of the PlugX malware and observed in six months more than 2.5 million connections from unique IP addresses.

title: Androxgh0st Malware Compromises Servers Worldwide for Botnet Attack
summary: Androxgh0st operators are exploiting multiple CVEs, including CVE-2021-3129 and CVE-2024-1709 to deploy a web shell on vulnerable servers, granting remote control capabilities. Evidence also suggests active web shells associated with CVE-2019-2725.

title: Chinese-Linked LightSpy iOS Spyware Targets South Asian iPhone Users
summary: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a "renewed" cyber espionage campaign targeting users in South Asia with the aim of delivering an Apple iOS spyware implant called LightSpy.

title: 'eXotic Visit' Spyware Campaign Targets Android Users in India and Pakistan
summary: The campaign is said to be highly targeted in nature, with the apps available on Google Play having a negligible number of installs ranging from zero to 45. The apps have since been taken down.

title: India Says it has Rescued 250 Citizens From Cambodian Cyber Slavery
summary: On Saturday, India’s Ministry of External Affairs responded to local media reports about Indians trapped in Cambodia, saying they are closely collaborating with Cambodian authorities to rescue them.

title: India's Android Users Hit by Malware-as-a-Service Campaign
summary: According to Broadcom, the campaign distributes malicious APK packages and seeks out banking information, SMS messages, and other sensitive information from a victim's device.

title: Report: Over 12 Million Auth Secrets and Keys Leaked on GitHub in 2023
summary: The "leakiest" countries in 2023 were India, the United States, Brazil, China, and others. The IT sector was the most affected, accounting for 65.9% of leaked secrets, followed by education at 20.1%, and other sectors making up the remaining 14%.

title: Critical Fortinet Flaw May Impact 150,000 Exposed Devices
summary: Approximately 150,000 Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy secure web gateway systems are vulnerable to CVE-2024-21762, a critical security issue that allows code execution without authentication.

title: GhostLocker 2.0 Haunts Businesses Across Middle East, Africa, and Asia
summary: Cybercriminal groups GhostSec and Stormous have collaborated to unleash GhostLocker 2.0 ransomware in targeted attacks across the Middle East, Africa, and Asia, affecting organizations in various sectors.

title: How the Application ‘XHelper’ Is Powering the Indian Money-Laundering Gig Economy
summary: Cybercriminals in India are using the XHelper app to recruit money mules in order to launder illicitly obtained funds through fake payment gateways and cryptocurrency conversions.

title: Multistage RA World Ransomware Uses Anti-AV Tactics, Exploits GPO
summary: The RA World ransomware employs multi-stage components to target healthcare organizations in the Latin American region, signifying a strategic and targeted approach to compromising systems within the target network.

title: New Mustang Panda Campaign Targets Asia with a Backdoor Dubbed DOPLUGS
summary: The DOPLUGS malware acts as a downloader and supports four backdoor commands, including the ability to download a generic version of the PlugX malware, and it utilizes the KillSomeOne module to support USB worm capability.

title: ResumeLooters Gang Steals User Information from Retail and Job Sites
summary: The stolen data, including over two million unique email addresses, was put up for sale in Chinese-speaking hacking-themed Telegram groups, with the majority of the focus on India, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam.

title: India-Linked Hackers Target Pakistan With Spyware in New Campaign
summary: The campaign, attributed to the Patchwork APT group, targeted mostly Pakistani users through a honey-trap romance scam, with some apps reaching over 1,400 installs on Google Play and revealing 148 compromised devices in Pakistan and India.

title: Threat Actors Selling 1.8TB Database of 750 Million Indian Mobile Users
summary: The compromised database is being sold on hacker forums, with two cybercrime groups offering the data for sale, highlighting the growing threat posed by emerging threat groups like CYBO CREW and its affiliates.

title: Pakistan-based Threat Actor Targets Indians with Fake Loan Android Application
summary: These actors create fake loan apps, obtain personal details through a KYC process, and then extort money by threatening to distribute manipulated photos. The apps exploit minimal permissions to avoid detection.

title: Data from Indian Online Gaming Platforms Teenpatti.com and Mpl.live on Sale
summary: The alleged data breach at Teenpatti.com and Mpl.live underscores the urgent need for improved security measures in online gaming platforms, especially in handling large volumes of personal user data.

title: Over 5,300 GitLab Servers Exposed to Zero-Click Account Takeover Attacks
summary: The flaw affects several versions of GitLab and patches have already been released. The servers at risk are mainly located in the United States, Germany, Russia, China, France, the U.K., India, and Canada.

title: Buggy API on Insurance Firm TTIBI's Website Leaked Over 650,000 Email Messages
summary: A security researcher Eaton Zveare discovered a misconfigured server belonging to Toyota Tsusho Insurance Broker India (TTIBI), which exposed over 650,000 Microsoft-hosted email messages.

title: Indian Air Force Potentially Targeted With Info-Stealing Malware
summary: The malware used in the campaign, a variant of Go Stealer, targets browsers like Firefox, Chrome, Edge, and Brave, and uses Slack for data exfiltration to blend in with regular business traffic.

title: Hacker Claims to Breach Indian ISP Hathway and Leaks Four Million Users' KYC Data
summary: The leaked data includes the personal information of over 41 million Hathway customers, but analysis suggests that the actual number of impacted accounts is around 4 million.

title: India Needs Better Cybersecurity for Space Systems
summary: Dr. Sreedhara Panicker Somanath, chairman of the Indian Space Research Organization, emphasized the importance of cybersecurity for the entire system during the recent inauguration of a cybersecurity training center.

title: Critical GeoServer Flaw Enabling Global Hack Campaigns
summary: The flaw in GeoServer, tracked as CVE-2024-36401 and with a CVSS score of 9.8, was swiftly capitalized on by hackers who launched campaigns using botnet families and cryptominers to spread malicious tools like Goreverse, a reverse proxy server.

title: India's Critical Infrastructure Suffers Spike in Cyberattacks
summary: India is experiencing a rise in cyberattacks on its critical infrastructure, particularly in the financial and government sectors, prompting the Reserve Bank of India to issue warnings about the need for enhanced cybersecurity measures.

title: MegaMedusa, RipperSec’s Public Web DDoS Attack Tool

title: Update: Ransomware Attack on Indian Payment System Traced Back to Jenkins Bug
summary: A recent ransomware attack on Indian payment systems has been traced back to a vulnerability in the widely used Jenkins automation system. The attack targeted a digital payment system used by many Indian banks.

title: Feds Seize Radar/Dispossessor Ransomware Gang Servers in US and Europe
summary: Federal authorities have seized servers belonging to the Radar/Dispossessor ransomware gang in the U.S. and Europe. The FBI dismantled dozens of servers linked to the group, which is believed to have ties to the LockBit ransomware enterprise.

title: Ransomware Attack On Service Provider Hits 300 Small Banks Across India
summary: The attack targeted C-Edge Technologies, a provider of banking systems for these banks. As a precaution, the National Payment Corporation of India (NPCI) has isolated these banks from the broader payment network to contain the attack.

summary: On Christmas Eve, multiple threat actors released substantial data leaks, potentially causing significant financial damage and adverse effects such as identity theft and fraud globally.

summary: The phishing emails trick victims into interacting with malicious PDF files that drop Rust-based payloads or PowerShell scripts, enabling the collection of confidential documents and system information.

summary: The trojan is distributed through WhatsApp messages, prompting users to download an APK for a mandatory verification procedure. Once installed, it collects personal and financial information and intercepts SMS messages to steal verification codes.

summary: India is experiencing a rise in cyberattacks on its critical infrastructure, particularly in the financial and government sectors, prompting the Reserve Bank of India to issue warnings about the need for enhanced cybersecurity measures.

title: MegaMedusa, RipperSec’s Public Web DDoS Attack Tool
summary: RipperSec, a pro-Palestinian hacktivist group based in Malaysia, has released MegaMedusa, a publicly available Web DDoS attack tool that simplifies launching large-scale DDoS attacks.

title: Update: Ransomware Attack on Indian Payment System Traced Back to Jenkins Bug
summary: A recent ransomware attack on Indian payment systems has been traced back to a vulnerability in the widely used Jenkins automation system. The attack targeted a digital payment system used by many Indian banks.

title: Feds Seize Radar/Dispossessor Ransomware Gang Servers in US and Europe
summary: Federal authorities have seized servers belonging to the Radar/Dispossessor ransomware gang in the U.S. and Europe. The FBI dismantled dozens of servers linked to the group, which is believed to have ties to the LockBit ransomware enterprise.

title: Ransomware Attack On Service Provider Hits 300 Small Banks Across India
summary: The attack targeted C-Edge Technologies, a provider of banking systems for these banks. As a precaution, the National Payment Corporation of India (NPCI) has isolated these banks from the broader payment network to contain the attack.

title: Phishing Campaign Targeting Mobile Users in India Using India Post Lures
summary: FortiGuard Labs Threat Research team has identified a fraud campaign targeting India Post users on social media, specifically iPhone users through smishing attacks. The Smishing Triad, a Chinese threat actor, is believed to be behind this campaign.

title: Patchwork Group Found Using Brute Ratel C4 and an Enhanced Version of PGoShell Backdoor
summary: Patchwork hackers targeted Bhutan using the advanced Brute Ratel C4 tool, along with an updated backdoor called PGoShell. This marks the first time Patchwork has been observed using the red teaming software.

title: TransparentTribe’s Spear-Phishing Targeting Indian Government Departments
summary: The malicious file, disguised as “Recommendation for the award of President’s.docm,” contained a VBA script that executed the CrimsonRAT remote control program, capable of stealing sensitive information.

title: Russia-Linked Brute-Force Campaign Targets EU via Microsoft Infrastructure
summary: The attackers are primarily targeting High-Value Targets (HVTs) in key infrastructure cities like Edinburgh and Dublin. Over half of the attack IPs are from Moscow, with the rest traced back to Amsterdam and Brussels.

title: North Korean Hackers May Have Attacked Indian Crypto Exchange WazirX
summary: Indian crypto exchange WazirX disclosed a loss of virtual assets worth more than $230 million due to a cyber attack linked to North Korea. The attack targeted a multi-signature wallet with six signatories, leading to a breach in security measures.

title: New BugSleep Backdoor Deployed in Recent MuddyWater Campaigns
summary: The deployment of BugSleep is a significant development in MuddyWater's tactics, targeting various sectors with phishing emails leading to the distribution of Remote Management Tools and the BugSleep malware.

title: Smishing Triad Targets India with Fraud Surge
summary: Warnings have been issued in India regarding a rise in fraudulent smishing attacks, with scammers impersonating India Post to deceive people into giving personal information or clicking on malicious links.

title: Regional Transport Office Themed Phishing Campaign Targets Android Users In India
summary: Phishing messages impersonating the Regional Transport Office have been circulating since 2024, claiming traffic violations and prompting users to download a malicious APK named "VAHAN PARIVAHAN.apk".

title: Indian Government Issues Serious Warning on Phishing Scams Alleging Sexual Offenses
summary: The emails falsely accuse recipients of sexual offences, using names and seals of authorities to appear authentic. Citizens are advised not to respond to such emails and report them to authorities.

title: Pro-Bangladeshi Hacktivists Enter Global Stage with Matryoshka 424 Alliance
summary: Team ARXU gained recognition earlier this year for targeting Romania over its support for Israel. The hacker group has a history of cyberattacks against Israel and its allies.

title: CapraRAT Spyware Variant Disguised as Popular Apps to Target Android Users
summary: The recent campaign shows updates to the group's techniques and social engineering tactics, as well as efforts to maximize the spyware's compatibility with older and modern versions of the Android operating system.

title: Chinese Cyberspies Employ Ransomware in Attacks for Diversion
summary: The adoption of ransomware in cyberespionage attacks helps adversaries blur the lines between APT and cybercriminal activity, leading to potential misattribution or concealing the true nature of the operation.

title: Pakistani Hackers Use DISGOMOJI Malware to Target Indian Government
summary: The threat actor uses a malware called DISGOMOJI, written in Golang, to infect Linux systems. DISGOMOJI is a modified version of Discord-C2, utilizing emojis for its command and control communication through Discord.

title: Pakistani APT 'Celestial Force' Spies on Indian Government, Defense Organizations
summary: A Pakistani threat actor called Cosmic Leopard has been conducting cyber espionage against Indian government-associated entities for the past six years using the GravityRAT Trojan for Windows and Android devices and the HeavyLift malware loader.

title: Noodle RAT: Reviewing the New Backdoor Used by Chinese-Speaking Groups
summary: Noodle RAT is a backdoor used by Chinese-speaking groups for cybercrime and espionage. This malware, both its Windows and Linux versions, has existed since 2016 but was misidentified as variants of other malware.

title: TargetCompany’s Linux Variant Targets ESXi Environments
summary: The TargetCompany ransomware group is now employing a new Linux variant that uses a custom shell script as a means of payload delivery and execution, a technique not seen in previous variants.

title: Indian Stock Exchange to Now Encrypt All Trader Messages
summary: India's Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) has told market participants they need to adopt encryption – which, shockingly, isn't already implemented – for certain messages sent to its trading platforms when using its Enhanced Trading Interface (ETI).

title: Indian Man Stole $37 Million in Crypto Using Fake Coinbase Pro Site
summary: The fake site was created to trick legitimate Coinbase customers into entering their login credentials and two-factor authentication codes, thinking it was the actual site.

title: Pakistani-Aligned APT36 Targets Indian Defense Organizations
summary: A politically motivated hacking group aligned with Pakistani interests is matching the Indian military's shift away from the Windows operating system with a heavy focus on malware encoded for Linux.

title: Cybercriminals are Targeting Elections in India With Influence Campaigns
summary: Around 16 different independent hacktivist groups are targeting Indian elections, including Anon Black Flag Indonesia, Anonymous Bangladesh, and Morocco Black Cyber Army, among others.

title: SideCopy APT Campaign Found Targeting Indian Universities
summary: Active since May 2023, the SideCopy APT campaign targets university students through sophisticated infection chains involving malicious LNK files, HTAs, and loader DLLs disguised as legitimate documents.

title: FCC Reveals Royal Tiger, its First Tagged Robocall Threat Actor
summary: The FCC's new robocall bad actor classification system, called Consumer Communications Information Services Threat (C-CIST), aims to help authorities identify and track threat actors abusing telecommunications infrastructure.

title: Researchers Sinkhole PlugX Malware Server With 2.5 Million Unique IPs
summary: Researchers have sinkholed a command and control server for a variant of the PlugX malware and observed in six months more than 2.5 million connections from unique IP addresses.

title: Androxgh0st Malware Compromises Servers Worldwide for Botnet Attack
summary: Androxgh0st operators are exploiting multiple CVEs, including CVE-2021-3129 and CVE-2024-1709 to deploy a web shell on vulnerable servers, granting remote control capabilities. Evidence also suggests active web shells associated with CVE-2019-2725.

title: Chinese-Linked LightSpy iOS Spyware Targets South Asian iPhone Users
summary: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a "renewed" cyber espionage campaign targeting users in South Asia with the aim of delivering an Apple iOS spyware implant called LightSpy.

title: 'eXotic Visit' Spyware Campaign Targets Android Users in India and Pakistan
summary: The campaign is said to be highly targeted in nature, with the apps available on Google Play having a negligible number of installs ranging from zero to 45. The apps have since been taken down.

title: India Says it has Rescued 250 Citizens From Cambodian Cyber Slavery
summary: On Saturday, India’s Ministry of External Affairs responded to local media reports about Indians trapped in Cambodia, saying they are closely collaborating with Cambodian authorities to rescue them.

title: India's Android Users Hit by Malware-as-a-Service Campaign
summary: According to Broadcom, the campaign distributes malicious APK packages and seeks out banking information, SMS messages, and other sensitive information from a victim's device.

title: Report: Over 12 Million Auth Secrets and Keys Leaked on GitHub in 2023
summary: The "leakiest" countries in 2023 were India, the United States, Brazil, China, and others. The IT sector was the most affected, accounting for 65.9% of leaked secrets, followed by education at 20.1%, and other sectors making up the remaining 14%.

title: Critical Fortinet Flaw May Impact 150,000 Exposed Devices
summary: Approximately 150,000 Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy secure web gateway systems are vulnerable to CVE-2024-21762, a critical security issue that allows code execution without authentication.

title: GhostLocker 2.0 Haunts Businesses Across Middle East, Africa, and Asia
summary: Cybercriminal groups GhostSec and Stormous have collaborated to unleash GhostLocker 2.0 ransomware in targeted attacks across the Middle East, Africa, and Asia, affecting organizations in various sectors.

title: How the Application ‘XHelper’ Is Powering the Indian Money-Laundering Gig Economy
summary: Cybercriminals in India are using the XHelper app to recruit money mules in order to launder illicitly obtained funds through fake payment gateways and cryptocurrency conversions.

title: Multistage RA World Ransomware Uses Anti-AV Tactics, Exploits GPO
summary: The RA World ransomware employs multi-stage components to target healthcare organizations in the Latin American region, signifying a strategic and targeted approach to compromising systems within the target network.

title: New Mustang Panda Campaign Targets Asia with a Backdoor Dubbed DOPLUGS
summary: The DOPLUGS malware acts as a downloader and supports four backdoor commands, including the ability to download a generic version of the PlugX malware, and it utilizes the KillSomeOne module to support USB worm capability.

title: ResumeLooters Gang Steals User Information from Retail and Job Sites
summary: The stolen data, including over two million unique email addresses, was put up for sale in Chinese-speaking hacking-themed Telegram groups, with the majority of the focus on India, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam.

title: India-Linked Hackers Target Pakistan With Spyware in New Campaign
summary: The campaign, attributed to the Patchwork APT group, targeted mostly Pakistani users through a honey-trap romance scam, with some apps reaching over 1,400 installs on Google Play and revealing 148 compromised devices in Pakistan and India.

title: Threat Actors Selling 1.8TB Database of 750 Million Indian Mobile Users
summary: The compromised database is being sold on hacker forums, with two cybercrime groups offering the data for sale, highlighting the growing threat posed by emerging threat groups like CYBO CREW and its affiliates.

title: Pakistan-based Threat Actor Targets Indians with Fake Loan Android Application
summary: These actors create fake loan apps, obtain personal details through a KYC process, and then extort money by threatening to distribute manipulated photos. The apps exploit minimal permissions to avoid detection.

title: Data from Indian Online Gaming Platforms Teenpatti.com and Mpl.live on Sale
summary: The alleged data breach at Teenpatti.com and Mpl.live underscores the urgent need for improved security measures in online gaming platforms, especially in handling large volumes of personal user data.

title: Over 5,300 GitLab Servers Exposed to Zero-Click Account Takeover Attacks
summary: The flaw affects several versions of GitLab and patches have already been released. The servers at risk are mainly located in the United States, Germany, Russia, China, France, the U.K., India, and Canada.

title: Buggy API on Insurance Firm TTIBI's Website Leaked Over 650,000 Email Messages
summary: A security researcher Eaton Zveare discovered a misconfigured server belonging to Toyota Tsusho Insurance Broker India (TTIBI), which exposed over 650,000 Microsoft-hosted email messages.

title: Indian Air Force Potentially Targeted With Info-Stealing Malware
summary: The malware used in the campaign, a variant of Go Stealer, targets browsers like Firefox, Chrome, Edge, and Brave, and uses Slack for data exfiltration to blend in with regular business traffic.

title: Hacker Claims to Breach Indian ISP Hathway and Leaks Four Million Users' KYC Data
summary: The leaked data includes the personal information of over 41 million Hathway customers, but analysis suggests that the actual number of impacted accounts is around 4 million.

title: MyEstatePoint Property Search Android App Leaks User Passwords, Email Addresses, and Phone Numbers
summary: The MyEstatePoint Property Search app, developed by NJ Technologies in India, left a publicly accessible MongoDB server containing sensitive information such as names, plain-text passwords, email addresses, phone numbers, and more.

title: Cybercriminals Launched ‘Leaksmas’ Event in the Dark Web Exposing Massive Volumes of Leaked PII and Compromised Data
summary: On Christmas Eve, multiple threat actors released substantial data leaks, potentially causing significant financial damage and adverse effects such as identity theft and fraud globally.

title: Operation RusticWeb Targets Indian Government Entities With Rust-Based Malware
summary: The phishing emails trick victims into interacting with malicious PDF files that drop Rust-based payloads or PowerShell scripts, enabling the collection of confidential documents and system information.

title: Indian Tech Giant HCL Investigating Ransomware Attack
summary: HCL Technologies has reported a ransomware attack on one of its projects in an isolated cloud environment. The company stated that the incident has had no impact on its overall network and that cybersecurity and data protection are top priorities.

title: Indian Banking Customers Targeted by Phishing Campaign Distributing Trojan as Fake Verification Tool
summary: The trojan is distributed through WhatsApp messages, prompting users to download an APK for a mandatory verification procedure. Once installed, it collects personal and financial information and intercepts SMS messages to steal verification codes.

title: Four Apprehended by Indian Authorities in ICMR Data Breach Impacting 800 Million People
summary: The suspects not only leaked data from the ICMR, but also claimed to have pilfered information from the FBI and Pakistan's CNIC, highlighting the extent of their illegal activities.

title: New Hacker Group 'GambleForce' Tageting APAC Firms Using SQL Injection Attacks
summary: The group relies on open-source tools like dirsearch, sqlmap, tinyproxy, and redis-rogue-getshell at different stages of the attacks and a post-exploitation framework called Cobalt Strike.

title: Millions of Patient Scans and Health Records Spilling Online Thanks to Decades-Old DICOM Bug
summary: Over 3,800 PACS servers across 110 countries are unintentionally exposing the private data of 16 million patients, including names, addresses, and even Social Security numbers.

title: Schools in Maine, Indiana and Georgia Contend Ransomware Attacks
summary: The Henry County Schools district in Georgia and the Hermon School Department in Maine are among the latest victims, with the former experiencing a ransomware attack and the latter having outdated software vulnerabilities exploited.

title: Russian and Chinese Interference Networks are ‘Building Audiences’ Ahead of 2024, Warns Meta
summary: Meta has disrupted influence operations from China and Russia, highlighting the challenges posed by generative artificial intelligence and the use of perception hacking to sow doubt in democratic processes.

title: App Used by Hundreds of Schools Leaking Children’s Data
summary: The leaked data poses a significant threat to children, as it can be exploited by malicious actors for extortion, impersonation, identity theft, fraud, and even potential child abuse.

title: Malicious Apps Disguised as Banks and Government Agencies Targeting Indian Android Users
summary: The malware poses as legitimate organizations like banks and government services, urging users to install the malicious app to update their PAN card details, ultimately stealing banking information and personal data.

title: Vietnamese Hackers Using New Delphi-Powered Malware to Target Indian Marketers
summary: The attackers utilize deceptive tactics, such as sending archive files disguised as PDFs, to trick victims into launching malicious executables and gain unauthorized access to their accounts.

title: SideCopy APT's Multi-Platform Onslaught Targets Indian Government and Defense Entities
summary: SideCopy is employing phishing tactics and using compromised domains with reused IP addresses to distribute malicious files and deploy malware, including a Linux variant of the Ares RAT, indicating a multi-platform approach in their attacks.

title: Socks5Systemz Proxy Botnet Infects 10,000 Systems Worldwide
summary: The botnet uses a domain generation algorithm (DGA) to connect with its command and control server and can be instructed to establish backconnect server connections, allowing infected devices to be used as proxy servers.

title: Mozi Botnet Put in its Grave Using Kill Switch
summary: The activation of the kill switch disabled various system services, replaced the original malware, and maintained persistence, suggesting a deliberate dismantling of the botnet.

title: Largest Indian Data Leak Involving 815 Million People’s COVID Test Data on Sale; Samples Verified
summary: The personal data of nearly 815 million citizens of India, including names, phone numbers, addresses, passport information, and Aadhaar card details, has been found for sale on the dark web.

title: Redcliffe Labs Database with Over 12 Million Patient Records Exposed
summary: The diagnostic service left 7 terabytes of sensitive data vulnerable, including medical diagnostic scans, test results, patient information, and even the names of attending doctors.

title: The Double-Edged Sword of Heightened Regulation for Financial Services
summary: The financial services industry faces unique cybersecurity challenges, including the need to protect sensitive data, navigate complex regulations, and manage partnerships and interconnectedness.

title: Chinese Scammers Exploiting India’s Real-Time Payment System
summary: Chinese scammers are using fake loan apps and India's Unified Payments Interface (UPI) to deceive victims and launder money. The scammers pose as loan providers and promise easy repayments in exchange for a fee.

title: DoNot Team's New Firebird Backdoor Hits Pakistan and Afghanistan
summary: Researchers have linked DoNot Team, a threat actor believed to be of Indian origin, to a .NET-based backdoor called Firebird. The backdoor has been used to target victims in Pakistan and Afghanistan.

title: India Targets Microsoft, Amazon Tech Support Scammers in Nationwide Crackdown
summary: India's Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) conducted raids at 76 locations across the country as part of Operation Chakra-II, targeting cybercrime operations involved in tech support scams and cryptocurrency fraud.

title: Vietnamese Hackers Hit Digital Marketers With Info-stealer Malware
summary: Vietnamese cybercrime groups are targeting the digital marketing sectors in the United Kingdom, United States, and India with various malware strains, including the DarkGate information stealer.

title: Indian State Government Fixes Website Bug That Revealed Aadhaar Numbers and Fingerprints
summary: The website bug allowed unauthorized access to land deed records by guessing sequential application numbers, highlighting the lack of robust security measures on the website.

title: Knight Ransomware Group Takes Responsibility for Cyberattack on India's National Health Mission
summary: The Knight ransomware group has openly claimed responsibility for the recent cyberattack on India's National Health Mission. The group shared screenshots of the attack on their dark web site.

title: Payment Gateway Provider Safexpay Technology Allegedly Hacked in a Nearly $2 Billion Scam
summary: As per the investigations, the ongoing fraud came to light after a complaint that some individuals had allegedly hacked into the six-year-old firm's payment gateway, and the funds were then transferred to at least 260 different bank accounts.

title: Indiana Attorney General Sues Provider Over Violation of Consumer Protection, Privacy Laws
summary: CarePointe, a medical provider in Indiana, is being sued by the state attorney general for allegedly being aware of security risks before a ransomware attack exposed the personal information of 45,000 patients.

title: Medusa Ransomware Group Claims Intrusions at Two New Victims, Sets Ransom Deadline
summary: The Medusa ransomware group has recently targeted two companies, Karam Chand Thapar & Bros. (Coal Sales) Ltd in India and the Sweden-based Windak Group, demanding significant ransoms for the release of encrypted data.

title: National Logistics Portal Leaks Sensitive Data Related to Operations at Indian Ports
summary: The publicly accessible AWS S3 buckets contained personal data, invoices, and internal documents, potentially disrupting trade and operations of India's ports and leading to significant ransom demands.

title: Transparent Tribe’s CapraRAT Mimics YouTube to Hijack Android Phones
summary: The CapraRAT mobile RAT hidden within these YouTube-themed apps gives the attacker control over various data on infected Android devices, including recording audio and video, collecting messages and call logs, and modifying files.

title: Massive DDoS Attack on US Financial Company Thwarted by Cybersecurity Firm
summary: The attack against the company, detected last week, peaked at 633.7 gigabits of traffic per second. According to the cloud computing company Gcore, as of this year, DDoS attacks can reach as high as 800 Gbps.

title: India: Ayush Jharkhand Portal Breached, 320,000 Patients’ Records Exposed
summary: The compromised data also contains sensitive information about doctors, including their PII, login credentials, usernames, passwords, and phone numbers. The data breach was initiated by a threat actor named "Tanaka".

title: More Than 200,000 Indiana Medicaid Members Possibly Exposed in CareSource Data Breach
summary: CareSource, the entity that manages software for the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration (FSSA), suffered a data breach in May that may have exposed the personal information of 212,193 Indiana Medicaid members.

title: Web Control, Crime Patrol or Real Pawns in Cybercrime
summary: A group of young employees in Hyderabad ran a sophisticated scam using VOIP to target unsuspecting people in the U.S. and trick them into buying gift cards, which were then converted into cryptocurrency and Indian Rupees.

title: Indian Government Alerts Mobile Users, Issues High Risk Warning for Android 13 and Other Versions
summary: These vulnerabilities, which have been classified as "high severity," could be exploited by attackers to gain control of vulnerable devices, steal sensitive information, or disrupt operations.

title: India Passes Data Protection Legislation in Parliament. Critics Fear Privacy Violation
summary: Indian lawmakers Wednesday approved a data protection legislation that “seeks to better regulate big tech firms and penalize companies for data breaches” as several groups expressed concern over citizens’ privacy rights.

title: QakBot Malware Operators Expand C2 Network with 15 New Servers
summary: A majority of the bot C2 servers, which communicate with the victim hosts, are located in India and the U.S. Destination IP addresses identified from outbound T2 connections are primarily based in the U.S., India, Mexico, and Venezuela.

title: "Mysterious Team Bangladesh" Targets India with DDoS Attacks and Data Breaches
summary: A hacktivist group known as Mysterious Team Bangladesh has been linked to over 750 distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks and 78 website defacements since June 2022.

title: CERT-In Cautions Internet Users Against Akira Ransomware Attack
summary: In its latest advisory, India's federal cybersecurity agency warned of a ransomware called 'Akira' that steals vital personal information and encrypts data leading to extortion of money from people.

title: New SOHO Router Botnet AVrecon Spreads to 70,000 Devices Across 20 Countries
summary: A majority of the infections are located in the U.K. and the U.S., followed by Argentina, Nigeria, Brazil, Italy, Bangladesh, Vietnam, India, Russia, and South Africa, among others.

summary: Dr. Sreedhara Panicker Somanath, chairman of the Indian Space Research Organization, emphasized the importance of cybersecurity for the entire system during the recent inauguration of a cybersecurity training center.

summary: Approximately 150,000 Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy secure web gateway systems are vulnerable to CVE-2024-21762, a critical security issue that allows code execution without authentication.

title: GhostLocker 2.0 Haunts Businesses Across Middle East, Africa, and Asia
summary: Cybercriminal groups GhostSec and Stormous have collaborated to unleash GhostLocker 2.0 ransomware in targeted attacks across the Middle East, Africa, and Asia, affecting organizations in various sectors.

title: How the Application ‘XHelper’ Is Powering the Indian Money-Laundering Gig Economy
summary: Cybercriminals in India are using the XHelper app to recruit money mules in order to launder illicitly obtained funds through fake payment gateways and cryptocurrency conversions.

title: Multistage RA World Ransomware Uses Anti-AV Tactics, Exploits GPO
summary: The RA World ransomware employs multi-stage components to target healthcare organizations in the Latin American region, signifying a strategic and targeted approach to compromising systems within the target network.

title: New Mustang Panda Campaign Targets Asia with a Backdoor Dubbed DOPLUGS
summary: The DOPLUGS malware acts as a downloader and supports four backdoor commands, including the ability to download a generic version of the PlugX malware, and it utilizes the KillSomeOne module to support USB worm capability.

title: ResumeLooters Gang Steals User Information from Retail and Job Sites
summary: The stolen data, including over two million unique email addresses, was put up for sale in Chinese-speaking hacking-themed Telegram groups, with the majority of the focus on India, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam.

title: India-Linked Hackers Target Pakistan With Spyware in New Campaign
summary: The campaign, attributed to the Patchwork APT group, targeted mostly Pakistani users through a honey-trap romance scam, with some apps reaching over 1,400 installs on Google Play and revealing 148 compromised devices in Pakistan and India.

title: Threat Actors Selling 1.8TB Database of 750 Million Indian Mobile Users
summary: The compromised database is being sold on hacker forums, with two cybercrime groups offering the data for sale, highlighting the growing threat posed by emerging threat groups like CYBO CREW and its affiliates.

title: Pakistan-based Threat Actor Targets Indians with Fake Loan Android Application
summary: These actors create fake loan apps, obtain personal details through a KYC process, and then extort money by threatening to distribute manipulated photos. The apps exploit minimal permissions to avoid detection.

title: Data from Indian Online Gaming Platforms Teenpatti.com and Mpl.live on Sale
summary: The alleged data breach at Teenpatti.com and Mpl.live underscores the urgent need for improved security measures in online gaming platforms, especially in handling large volumes of personal user data.

title: Over 5,300 GitLab Servers Exposed to Zero-Click Account Takeover Attacks
summary: The flaw affects several versions of GitLab and patches have already been released. The servers at risk are mainly located in the United States, Germany, Russia, China, France, the U.K., India, and Canada.

title: Buggy API on Insurance Firm TTIBI's Website Leaked Over 650,000 Email Messages
summary: A security researcher Eaton Zveare discovered a misconfigured server belonging to Toyota Tsusho Insurance Broker India (TTIBI), which exposed over 650,000 Microsoft-hosted email messages.

title: Indian Air Force Potentially Targeted With Info-Stealing Malware
summary: The malware used in the campaign, a variant of Go Stealer, targets browsers like Firefox, Chrome, Edge, and Brave, and uses Slack for data exfiltration to blend in with regular business traffic.

title: Hacker Claims to Breach Indian ISP Hathway and Leaks Four Million Users' KYC Data
summary: The leaked data includes the personal information of over 41 million Hathway customers, but analysis suggests that the actual number of impacted accounts is around 4 million.

title: MyEstatePoint Property Search Android App Leaks User Passwords, Email Addresses, and Phone Numbers
summary: The MyEstatePoint Property Search app, developed by NJ Technologies in India, left a publicly accessible MongoDB server containing sensitive information such as names, plain-text passwords, email addresses, phone numbers, and more.

title: Cybercriminals Launched ‘Leaksmas’ Event in the Dark Web Exposing Massive Volumes of Leaked PII and Compromised Data
summary: On Christmas Eve, multiple threat actors released substantial data leaks, potentially causing significant financial damage and adverse effects such as identity theft and fraud globally.

title: Operation RusticWeb Targets Indian Government Entities With Rust-Based Malware
summary: The phishing emails trick victims into interacting with malicious PDF files that drop Rust-based payloads or PowerShell scripts, enabling the collection of confidential documents and system information.

title: Indian Tech Giant HCL Investigating Ransomware Attack
summary: HCL Technologies has reported a ransomware attack on one of its projects in an isolated cloud environment. The company stated that the incident has had no impact on its overall network and that cybersecurity and data protection are top priorities.

title: Indian Banking Customers Targeted by Phishing Campaign Distributing Trojan as Fake Verification Tool
summary: The trojan is distributed through WhatsApp messages, prompting users to download an APK for a mandatory verification procedure. Once installed, it collects personal and financial information and intercepts SMS messages to steal verification codes.

title: Four Apprehended by Indian Authorities in ICMR Data Breach Impacting 800 Million People
summary: The suspects not only leaked data from the ICMR, but also claimed to have pilfered information from the FBI and Pakistan's CNIC, highlighting the extent of their illegal activities.

title: New Hacker Group 'GambleForce' Tageting APAC Firms Using SQL Injection Attacks
summary: The group relies on open-source tools like dirsearch, sqlmap, tinyproxy, and redis-rogue-getshell at different stages of the attacks and a post-exploitation framework called Cobalt Strike.

title: Millions of Patient Scans and Health Records Spilling Online Thanks to Decades-Old DICOM Bug
summary: Over 3,800 PACS servers across 110 countries are unintentionally exposing the private data of 16 million patients, including names, addresses, and even Social Security numbers.

title: Schools in Maine, Indiana and Georgia Contend Ransomware Attacks
summary: The Henry County Schools district in Georgia and the Hermon School Department in Maine are among the latest victims, with the former experiencing a ransomware attack and the latter having outdated software vulnerabilities exploited.

title: Russian and Chinese Interference Networks are ‘Building Audiences’ Ahead of 2024, Warns Meta
summary: Meta has disrupted influence operations from China and Russia, highlighting the challenges posed by generative artificial intelligence and the use of perception hacking to sow doubt in democratic processes.

title: App Used by Hundreds of Schools Leaking Children’s Data
summary: The leaked data poses a significant threat to children, as it can be exploited by malicious actors for extortion, impersonation, identity theft, fraud, and even potential child abuse.

title: Malicious Apps Disguised as Banks and Government Agencies Targeting Indian Android Users
summary: The malware poses as legitimate organizations like banks and government services, urging users to install the malicious app to update their PAN card details, ultimately stealing banking information and personal data.

title: Vietnamese Hackers Using New Delphi-Powered Malware to Target Indian Marketers
summary: The attackers utilize deceptive tactics, such as sending archive files disguised as PDFs, to trick victims into launching malicious executables and gain unauthorized access to their accounts.

title: SideCopy APT's Multi-Platform Onslaught Targets Indian Government and Defense Entities
summary: SideCopy is employing phishing tactics and using compromised domains with reused IP addresses to distribute malicious files and deploy malware, including a Linux variant of the Ares RAT, indicating a multi-platform approach in their attacks.

title: Socks5Systemz Proxy Botnet Infects 10,000 Systems Worldwide
summary: The botnet uses a domain generation algorithm (DGA) to connect with its command and control server and can be instructed to establish backconnect server connections, allowing infected devices to be used as proxy servers.

title: Mozi Botnet Put in its Grave Using Kill Switch
summary: The activation of the kill switch disabled various system services, replaced the original malware, and maintained persistence, suggesting a deliberate dismantling of the botnet.

title: Largest Indian Data Leak Involving 815 Million People’s COVID Test Data on Sale; Samples Verified
summary: The personal data of nearly 815 million citizens of India, including names, phone numbers, addresses, passport information, and Aadhaar card details, has been found for sale on the dark web.

title: Redcliffe Labs Database with Over 12 Million Patient Records Exposed
summary: The diagnostic service left 7 terabytes of sensitive data vulnerable, including medical diagnostic scans, test results, patient information, and even the names of attending doctors.

title: The Double-Edged Sword of Heightened Regulation for Financial Services
summary: The financial services industry faces unique cybersecurity challenges, including the need to protect sensitive data, navigate complex regulations, and manage partnerships and interconnectedness.

title: Chinese Scammers Exploiting India’s Real-Time Payment System
summary: Chinese scammers are using fake loan apps and India's Unified Payments Interface (UPI) to deceive victims and launder money. The scammers pose as loan providers and promise easy repayments in exchange for a fee.

title: DoNot Team's New Firebird Backdoor Hits Pakistan and Afghanistan
summary: Researchers have linked DoNot Team, a threat actor believed to be of Indian origin, to a .NET-based backdoor called Firebird. The backdoor has been used to target victims in Pakistan and Afghanistan.

title: India Targets Microsoft, Amazon Tech Support Scammers in Nationwide Crackdown
summary: India's Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) conducted raids at 76 locations across the country as part of Operation Chakra-II, targeting cybercrime operations involved in tech support scams and cryptocurrency fraud.

title: Vietnamese Hackers Hit Digital Marketers With Info-stealer Malware
summary: Vietnamese cybercrime groups are targeting the digital marketing sectors in the United Kingdom, United States, and India with various malware strains, including the DarkGate information stealer.

title: Indian State Government Fixes Website Bug That Revealed Aadhaar Numbers and Fingerprints
summary: The website bug allowed unauthorized access to land deed records by guessing sequential application numbers, highlighting the lack of robust security measures on the website.

title: Knight Ransomware Group Takes Responsibility for Cyberattack on India's National Health Mission
summary: The Knight ransomware group has openly claimed responsibility for the recent cyberattack on India's National Health Mission. The group shared screenshots of the attack on their dark web site.

title: Payment Gateway Provider Safexpay Technology Allegedly Hacked in a Nearly $2 Billion Scam
summary: As per the investigations, the ongoing fraud came to light after a complaint that some individuals had allegedly hacked into the six-year-old firm's payment gateway, and the funds were then transferred to at least 260 different bank accounts.

title: Indiana Attorney General Sues Provider Over Violation of Consumer Protection, Privacy Laws
summary: CarePointe, a medical provider in Indiana, is being sued by the state attorney general for allegedly being aware of security risks before a ransomware attack exposed the personal information of 45,000 patients.

title: Medusa Ransomware Group Claims Intrusions at Two New Victims, Sets Ransom Deadline
summary: The Medusa ransomware group has recently targeted two companies, Karam Chand Thapar & Bros. (Coal Sales) Ltd in India and the Sweden-based Windak Group, demanding significant ransoms for the release of encrypted data.

title: National Logistics Portal Leaks Sensitive Data Related to Operations at Indian Ports
summary: The publicly accessible AWS S3 buckets contained personal data, invoices, and internal documents, potentially disrupting trade and operations of India's ports and leading to significant ransom demands.

title: Transparent Tribe’s CapraRAT Mimics YouTube to Hijack Android Phones
summary: The CapraRAT mobile RAT hidden within these YouTube-themed apps gives the attacker control over various data on infected Android devices, including recording audio and video, collecting messages and call logs, and modifying files.

title: Massive DDoS Attack on US Financial Company Thwarted by Cybersecurity Firm
summary: The attack against the company, detected last week, peaked at 633.7 gigabits of traffic per second. According to the cloud computing company Gcore, as of this year, DDoS attacks can reach as high as 800 Gbps.

title: India: Ayush Jharkhand Portal Breached, 320,000 Patients’ Records Exposed
summary: The compromised data also contains sensitive information about doctors, including their PII, login credentials, usernames, passwords, and phone numbers. The data breach was initiated by a threat actor named "Tanaka".

title: More Than 200,000 Indiana Medicaid Members Possibly Exposed in CareSource Data Breach
summary: CareSource, the entity that manages software for the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration (FSSA), suffered a data breach in May that may have exposed the personal information of 212,193 Indiana Medicaid members.

title: Web Control, Crime Patrol or Real Pawns in Cybercrime
summary: A group of young employees in Hyderabad ran a sophisticated scam using VOIP to target unsuspecting people in the U.S. and trick them into buying gift cards, which were then converted into cryptocurrency and Indian Rupees.

title: Indian Government Alerts Mobile Users, Issues High Risk Warning for Android 13 and Other Versions
summary: These vulnerabilities, which have been classified as "high severity," could be exploited by attackers to gain control of vulnerable devices, steal sensitive information, or disrupt operations.

title: India Passes Data Protection Legislation in Parliament. Critics Fear Privacy Violation
summary: Indian lawmakers Wednesday approved a data protection legislation that “seeks to better regulate big tech firms and penalize companies for data breaches” as several groups expressed concern over citizens’ privacy rights.

title: QakBot Malware Operators Expand C2 Network with 15 New Servers
summary: A majority of the bot C2 servers, which communicate with the victim hosts, are located in India and the U.S. Destination IP addresses identified from outbound T2 connections are primarily based in the U.S., India, Mexico, and Venezuela.

title: "Mysterious Team Bangladesh" Targets India with DDoS Attacks and Data Breaches
summary: A hacktivist group known as Mysterious Team Bangladesh has been linked to over 750 distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks and 78 website defacements since June 2022.

title: CERT-In Cautions Internet Users Against Akira Ransomware Attack
summary: In its latest advisory, India's federal cybersecurity agency warned of a ransomware called 'Akira' that steals vital personal information and encrypts data leading to extortion of money from people.

title: New SOHO Router Botnet AVrecon Spreads to 70,000 Devices Across 20 Countries
summary: A majority of the infections are located in the U.K. and the U.S., followed by Argentina, Nigeria, Brazil, Italy, Bangladesh, Vietnam, India, Russia, and South Africa, among others.

title: DDoS Attacks Soar by 168% on Government Services, Report Warns
summary: According to StormWall’s Q2 2023 Report, the United States, India, and China remain the most heavily targeted countries, bearing the brunt of the escalating DDoS attacks.

title: Large Indian Tech Retailer Exposes Employee and Customer Data
summary: The tech retailer Poorvika had a non-password-protected data breach exposing sensitive employee and customer data. The breach included a vast number of records, including personal information, email addresses, tax invoices, and payment receipts.

title: An Overview of the Different Versions of the Trigona Ransomware
summary: Trigona ransomware is a relatively new family that targets compromised MSSQL servers and has been detected mainly in the technology and healthcare industries in countries such as the US, India, and Israel.

title: MULTI#STORM Campaign Targets India and U.S. with Remote Access Trojans
summary: "The attack chain ends with the victim machine infected with multiple unique remote access trojan malware instances, such as Warzone RAT and Quasar RAT," Securonix researchers Den Iuzvyk, Tim Peck, and Oleg Kolesnikov said.

title: Chinese Hackers Targeted G7 Summit Through MS Office Flaw
summary: Suspected Chinese APT groups exploited a 17-year-old Microsoft Office vulnerability in May to launch malware attacks against foreign government officials who attended a G7 summit in Hiroshima, Japan.

title: Camaro Dragon’s WispRider Malware Self-Propagates Through USB Flash Drives
summary: In addition to backdoor capabilities and the ability to propagate through USB using the HopperTick launcher, the payload includes additional features, such as a bypass for SmadAV, an anti-virus solution popular in Southeast Asia.

title: Over 100,000 Stolen ChatGPT Account Credentials Sold on Dark Web Marketplaces
summary: The Asia-Pacific region experienced the highest number of compromised accounts, reaching approximately 41,000. In comparison, Europe had nearly 17,000 compromised accounts, while North America ranked fifth, reporting around 4,700 instances.

title: Android Spyware GravityRAT Goes After WhatsApp Backups
summary: The BingeChat campaign is ongoing and the spyware can exfiltrate WhatsApp backups and receive commands to delete files. The actor behind GravityRAT remains unknown, and the group is tracked internally as SpaceCobra.

title: Darkweb credit card marts in decline across Asia
summary: The number of stolen Asian credit card numbers on dark web markets has fallen sharply, Group-IB told Singapore's ATxSG conference. Instead, criminals have escalated their attempts to steal corporate documents – with India being the prime target.

title: Sneaky DogeRAT Trojan Poses as Popular Apps, Targets Indian Android Users
summary: The malware is distributed via social media and messaging platforms under the guise of legitimate applications like Opera Mini, OpenAI ChatGOT, and Premium versions of YouTube, Netflix, and Instagram.
